articles.headline: Spy vs. Spy: Dig for on-line gold
articles.summary: This article discusses the use of online resources for background checks, exploring Web resources, commercial services, and data brokers. It highlights the importance of online databases and resources like Lexis/Nexis, Dialog, and Dow Jones News Service as vital tools for journalists.

articles.headline: Backgrounding sites
articles.summary: The piece lists several useful websites for reporters to begin backgrounding people and businesses online, featuring sites maintained by experts in news research.

articles.headline: Find it on CD-ROM
articles.summary: This handout provides a comprehensive list of CD-ROM resources for journalists, suggesting alternatives to spending time at courthouses or ordering faxes for background information.

articles.headline: Pushing the bridge limits
articles.summary: The article details an investigation into the violation of weight limits on bridges in New York’s suburbs, discovering potential for disasters due to overlooked signage and enforcement.

articles.headline: Pawnshops draw criminals
articles.summary: This report explores the correlation between high crime rates and the prevalence of pawnshops in Fort Lauderdale, highlighting cases where frequent pawners have extensive criminal records.
